Column Comment.0: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.Valid types of seismic sets include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_3D, SEIS_SEGMENT andSEIS_SURVEY.
Column Comment.2: SEISMIC SET LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the approval granted toconduct seismic or geophysical operations.
Column Comment.3: SEISMIC LICENSE CONDITION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the condition thatis applied to this license.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: SEISMIC LICENSE CONDITION CODE: A validated set of codes for a conditiontype.
Column Comment.6: CONDITION DESCRIPTION: textual description of the condition applied to thelicense.
Column Comment.7: SEISMIC LICENSE CONDITION TYPE: The type of condition that is applied to aseismic or geophysical license. Could include stipulations about disposal, timbersalvage, inspections, compliance with legislation etc.
Column Comment.8: CONDITION VALUE: a numeric value associated with the condition, such as a rateor an amount.
Column Comment.10: CONTACT BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ID: the unique indicator for the businessassociate who is the contact for this condition.
Column Comment.11: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.12: DESCRIPTION: A short narrative description of the condition.
Column Comment.13: DUE CONDITION: The state that must be achieved for the condition to becomeeffective. For example, a report may be due 60 days after operations commence (orcease).
Column Comment.14: DUE DATE: The date that this condition must be fulfilled by.
Column Comment.15: DUE FREQUENCY: the frequency with which this condition must be met, such as anannual review. Where conditions are cycling in this way, please use the project (forwork flow) or obligations ( for payments) module to track completions.
Column Comment.16: DUE TERM: the period within which this condition must be satisfied, usually followingcompletion of operations.
Column Comment.17: DUE TERM UNIT OF MEASURE: the unit of measure for the due term, usually days,weeks, months.
Column Comment.18: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.19: EXEMPT INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating that the holder of the license is exemptfrom this condition.
Column Comment.20: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.21: FULFILLED BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: unique identifier for the business associatewho fulfilled this condition.
Column Comment.22: FULFILLED DATE: The date that this condition was fulfilled.
Column Comment.23: FULFILLED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this condition has been fulfilled.
Column Comment.24: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.25: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.26: RESTRICTION IDENTIFER: Unique identifier for a restriction.
Column Comment.27: RESTRICTION VERSION: The version number of the restriction. In some areas,changes to the detailed requirements of a restriction result in versioning.
Column Comment.28: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.29: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.31: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.33: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
